othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Procedure to clean and replace cooling system components and coolant to maintain thermal performance and reliability.

note.p: At operating temperature, the engine coolant is hot and under pressure.
Check the coolant level only after the engine has been stopped and the filler cap is cool enough to touch with your bare hand.
Remove the filler cap slowly to relieve pressure. Cooling system conditioner contains alkali. Avoid contact with the skin and eyes to prevent personal injury.
Use all cleaning solutions with care.

context.p: The lift truck must be level, the forks lowered, the parking brake engaged, the transmission in NEUTRAL and the engine stopped and cool.

li.p: Turn the radiator cap slowly to relieve the pressure, and then remove the cap.
Open radiator drain valve. Allow the coolant to drain. Drain the recovery bottle.

Close radiator drain valve and install block drain plug. Fill the cooling system with 1 kg (2 lb) sodium bisulphate per 40 liters (10 gallons) of water. Most commercial cooling system cleaners can be used.
Start and run the engine for 30 minutes.
Stop the engine and drain the cleaning solution.
Flush the system with clean water, until draining water is clear.
Close the drain valve and install the block drain plug. Fill the system with neutralizing solution, 250 g (1/2 lb) sodium carbonate per 40 liters (10 gallons) of water.
Start and run the engine for 10 minutes.
Stop the engine and drain the neutralizing solution.
Flush the system with clean water until draining water is clear.
Close the drain valve and install the block drain plug. Add coolant to the top of the filler neck.
Start and run the engine to stabilise the coolant level. See topic, “Coolant level - Check” in “Every 10 Service Hours or Daily”.
